What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about the Mesoamerican region and its ancient cultures and civilizations.
I learned a lot about the class topic. I also learned how to better talk about readings in class and on paper.

The most important skill that I developed by taking this course was how to view and observe a region or subject from an unbiased and anthropological perspective. Mesoamerica is a region that has been clouded by over half a millennium of historical bias so an integral part of the course was rebuilding the foundations for our knowledge of Mesoamerica. Many aspects of Mesoamerican culture and history do not fit into the Eurocentric molds of viewing history and anthropology. The insight I picked up in this course regarding processing cultures and histories is knowledge that I will continue to use throughout my educational and professional career.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There were no weaknesses! This course was perfectly conceived and delivered!
It was just a bit fast, but that was expected from a summer class. Other than that, it felt pretty balanced.

The course did an excellent job painting a picture of the anthropological region of Mesoamerica, from the first human settlements to the Spanish conquest. We discussed not only the history of the region, but the history of the modern archeological and anthropological efforts in the region and how they developed. We also compared historical, pre-Columbian practices to practices of modern indigenous people in the region today. Overall, the course not only presented the history of Mesoamerica, but put it into context through the discussions of how the modern study came to be along with how pre-Colombian culture is still prominent and significant today in many parts of Mesoamerica.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This was the BEST course I've taken at Yale!

Yes! Very fun and interesting class. Especially if you want to learn more about archaeology. It definitely gave me great insight into what archaeology is really about and all the different aspects of the study.
Yes, this course provided a great background in Mesoamerican archeology and anthropology along with general methodology as a whole.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
